itemDescription: Stobart, Mabel Annie St Clair [née Mabel Annie Boulton; other married name Mabel Annie Stobart Greenhalgh] (1862–1954), medical relief worker and writer

wikipedia_page.main: Mabel Annie St Clair Stobart (nee Boulton; 3 February 1862 – 7 December 1954) was a British suffragist and aid-worker.  She created and commanded all-women medical units to serve in the Balkan Wars and the First World War. She became the first woman to achieve the rank of Major in any national army.  She was also the author of several books and articles.
